title: the more i see about garens villain system, the more i dislike it
body:
initially it was just the problem of not being able to control who has the mark, which is an incredibly anoying mechanic.

but after thinking about it, i also came to realize that the true damage is actually not going to make much of a difference. the thing is, if it works as intended, its to be expected that the mark will usually stick to an assassin, adc or mage. simply someone who usually racks up a lot of kills.

but those champions are squishy enough, that with a proper midgame build i can take them down in one ability chain right now anyways. especially itemized into critical strike.

the main difference is, that its easier to get in range of those dudes and stick to them right now (with the right item build), than it will be after the changes.

so the only nieche cases in which these changes are actually better for him in terms of damage compared to the live version, are if youre dealing with a relatively tanky carry type champion like a fed jax or irelia, who wants to get up close to you by himself. (and in that case youre probably the reason why theyre fed in the first place and cant duel them anyways).

all the removal of his item diversity with crit items, his self slow on the spin and the nerf to the silence and tencity make him feel pretty terrible to play.


apparantly it wasnt enough, that he was susceptible to kiting. he actually now kites himself. this is the worst change you could come up with, next to the silence nerf and his new, and bland itemization.

And I don't even play Garen.

To be honest, i think his new late game is worse now.


Sure, he deals more damage now even without the Villain system....


But you are also far more frail than ever, you have zero stickyness due to the massive slow, your Tenacity got deleted and his one form of CC took a huge nerf. On Live i rarely had issues killing ADCs that were out of position, for instance.

Then theres the Villain system. I managed to make use it of fairly rarely, and although it got me a few kills, it is just too unreliable and seems to be eating a lot of Garen's power budget.
I agree completely. While the Darius changes are not too objectionable, all the rest seem like they will cause serious problems. Skarner, especially, will have issues after this.

the skarner changes just seem pretty snowbally to either side.

if his team is ahead in map control theyre even more ahead. if theyre behind, theyre even more behind.

That, and it's much harder for him to stun multiple targets in a single fight. If the mark from your E runs out, you'll be waiting a while before you can use it again. Before, he could stack lots of stuns with his q. It's what made him useful in longer teamfights. Sure, his ult is pretty good at locking down a single target, but in longer fights he needs to get stuns off on whoever the main threat is.

what scares me, is that they dont even understand that the attack range buff is not actually a buff or useful for him. they gave it to him because he has a big sword (seriously, that was his answer on the pbe thread).

what it WILL mean for garen is, that between hitting an opponent from a further distance with his q to activating his spin, that hes 50 units further away from his target when he goes into the spin. which combined with the self slow makes it easier to walk out of it.

so its not even a buff in that sense. not to mention, he doesnt even fucking auto much. he isnt darius who wants to auto his opponent between q casts to apply bleed stacks. theyre putting some of his power budget into a useless feature.

i mean if he even ahd his crit scaling, then it would be somewhat useful with a ghostblade? but thats less of a useful option for him now.

Thing is I can see this new garen being abused by enemy team.  His ulti is taken out of his hands and into the enemy team which I dislike.  It forces garen to dive the enemy back line for the adc with all the kills most game rather than be in the middle of the fight as brawler and cc sponge as well as soak up damage for his team.  This means you have to have another tank or brawler to fill this role now that Garen is at a disadvantage if he doesn't go straight for the villian
